body:
I observe this issue with helm 2.16.5 and 2.16.6, it's not reproducible in our old cluster with helm 2.13.1 and k8s 1.12.2

## how to reproduce
* deploy a helm chart with multiple k8s deployments
* run `helm status mychart`
## expected output
all pods from all deployments are listed in `v1/Pod(related)`

## observed output
only pods from one of deployments is displayed in `v1/Pod(related)` and it is repeated multiple times
```
==> v1/Pod(related)
NAME                            READY  STATUS   RESTARTS  AGE
test5-postgres-bb8f94bb7-48btg  1/1    Running  0         21h
test5-postgres-bb8f94bb7-48btg  1/1    Running  0         21h
test5-postgres-bb8f94bb7-48btg  1/1    Running  0         21h
test5-postgres-bb8f94bb7-48btg  1/1    Running  0         21h
```

for the reference,
```
> kubectl get pod
NAME                                   READY   STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
test5-web-66c9cd5747-wtc5n       2/2     Running   0          21h
test5-celery-worker-65f575db9b-qhp9z   1/1     Running   0          21h
test5-postgres-bb8f94bb7-48btg         1/1     Running   0          21h
test5-redis-598f7948d7-x5jj8           1/1     Running   0          21h
```

Output of `helm version`:
```
> helm-2.16.6 version
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.16.6", GitCommit:"dd2e5695da88625b190e6b22e9542550ab503a47", GitTreeState:"clean"}
Server: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.16.6", GitCommit:"dd2e5695da88625b190e6b22e9542550ab503a47", GitTreeState:"clean"}
```
Output of `kubectl version`:
```
> kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"18", GitVersion:"v1.18.0", GitCommit:"9e991415386e4cf155a24b1da15becaa390438d8", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2020-03-26T06:17:09Z", GoVersion:"go1.14", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"16", GitVersion:"v1.16.7", GitCommit:"be3d344ed06bff7a4fc60656200a93c74f31f9a4", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2020-02-11T19:24:46Z", GoVersion:"go1.13.6", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
